messages: d60411cf04cf3045492685f068cc32e8 (02:33): i have a problem installin solaris software express

d60411cf04cf3045492685f068cc32e8 (02:35): when i want to part my disk, the disk not appear...
d60411cf04cf3045492685f068cc32e8 (02:36): and solaris does not  see it
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (02:36): does  it have another OS on it?
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (02:37): perhaps one that has a  efi label on it... solaris install doesn't like  efi labels
d60411cf04cf3045492685f068cc32e8 (02:37): i have debian linux installed
d60411cf04cf3045492685f068cc32e8 (02:38): someone said me that i need a driver for SATA disks, and i need load this before installing
f39913b334ab00d8d8d976435ca063c2 (02:38): any known memory leaks in zfs code in solaris 10 118833-20?
d60411cf04cf3045492685f068cc32e8 (02:38): but i don't know how to insert this one before my installing
f39913b334ab00d8d8d976435ca063c2 (02:38): and how to get some statistics out of the kernel dump file?
d60411cf04cf3045492685f068cc32e8 (02:40): anyone have installed solaris on a SATA disk?
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (02:42): but its not shared...
d60411cf04cf3045492685f068cc32e8 (02:45): and it install in a normal way?
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (02:46): i had to create a new drive label using  format -e  but beyond that it was fine
d60411cf04cf3045492685f068cc32e8 (02:47): another different question.
d60411cf04cf3045492685f068cc32e8 (02:47): anyone here have the SCSA certification?

4bf63d9d8026c3c61c894765144446fd (03:01): hi all...i think i have a serious error on an enterprise 450...when rebooting i got the following error in the end: "SCSI transport failed: reason 'reset': giving up" and "WARNING: failed to restart init (1M) (err=5): system reboot required"
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (03:03): check that the disks are seated, if that doesn't work do a  probe-scsi-all
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (03:03): see if all the drives show up
4bf63d9d8026c3c61c894765144446fd (03:04): another important message might be: "WARNING: /pci@1f,4000/scsi@3/sd@1,0 (sd19): Error for command: read Error Level: retryable"
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (03:04): if still have problems remove all drives and add back one at a time... if it fails  still with no drves, its the controller or the backplane
4bf63d9d8026c3c61c894765144446fd (03:05): ok..i will try jamesd..

4bf63d9d8026c3c61c894765144446fd (03:08): the funny part was that i was remote desktopping with a NX client when the system crashed....then when i typed in something on the server, i saw strange characters on the screen like: @@@!!@@#@#@@@@
4bf63d9d8026c3c61c894765144446fd (03:09): anyway, with probe-scsi-all i get a "bus fault" message running on my screen
4bf63d9d8026c3c61c894765144446fd (03:09): let's try to take out all the HD's..
4bf63d9d8026c3c61c894765144446fd (03:15): ok...when i put back HD 0, it is recognized by probe-scsi-all and i do not get any error
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (03:15): that is a good sign.. but it could be any of the disks that cause it
4bf63d9d8026c3c61c894765144446fd (03:16): i will now put them back disk for disk and everytime doing a probe-scsi-all..
